intro: Russelia sarmentosa f. eglandulata, commonly known as the glandless russelia, is a compact, trailing plant native to South America. It features vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange, attracting pollinators like hummingbirds and bees. The plant has wiry, sprawling stems that root at the nodes, making it ideal for hanging baskets or containers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, requiring regular watering during the growing season.
